newsitem.title: FINLAND: ICE HOCKEY-ZARRILLO LEADS ITALY TO COMEBACK WIN.
newsitem.headline: ICE HOCKEY-ZARRILLO LEADS ITALY TO COMEBACK WIN.

text.p: Bruno Zarrillo scored the tieing and winning goals as Italy stormed back from a three-goal deficit to beat Latvia 5-4 at the ice hockey world championship on Monday.

Zarrillo, the leading scorer in the German hockey league this season, tapped in a loose puck with just over 10 minutes remaining to cap the comeback and give the Italians their first win of the tournament after they trailed 4-1 midway through the second period.

It was the second straight one-goal loss for the Latvians, who are playing in the championships for the first time since 1939 as an independent nation. Latvia dropped an identical 5-4 decision to the United States in their opener on Sunday.
The Latvians looked headed for their first win in 57 years when they exploded for three goals in 97 seconds to take a 4-1 lead.
Latvia's Leonids Tambijevs scored the only goal of the first period. Leo Guiseppe Insam had opened the secord period scoring to pull Italy even at 1-1.
Then Andrei Maticins and Harius Vitolins fired goals 15 seconds apart and Aleksandrs Macijevskis added another a minute later to leave Latvia looking home and dry.
Gaetano Orlando ignited the Italian comeback when he scored to end the second period and reduce Latvia's advantage to 4-2.
Mario Chitarroni continued the comeback in the final period scoring Italy's third and setting the stage for Zarrillo's tying goal.
